project_abstract.cdata: The primary objectives of the Road Sector Engineering Project are to: (1) provide the economic and design analysis to improve road infrastructure, which will improve market linkages, promote economic growth and thereby alleviate poverty, as well as facilitate access to public health and education services; (2) establish contract administration capacity within the Road Transport Construction Department (RTCD) to facilitate private sector involvement in road and bridge works; and (3) improve the efficiency of RTCD's force account maintenance and construction capacity. The project comprises two components: (1) Infrastructure strengthening studies, including a feasibility study and environmental impact assessment to determine design and construction standards for road rehabilitation and upgrading, followed by detailed engineering designs for civil works; and a national bridge condition and structural strength survey to develop a prioritized program of bridge works. (2) Institutional strengthening, including technical assistance and training for RTCD personnel in contract administration organization, systems and procedures; hands-on training to upgrade mechanical skills, including spare parts for the training program; training of trainers (both in-house and overseas); and construction of a small training facility and workshop, including basic workshop equipment and training aides.
